intro: Collomia grandiflora var. cryptantha, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. The species is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
